Issues.Title: test(localize): fix integration test failures on windows
Issues.Body:
Resolves the following issues which prevented the `localize` integration tests from passing on a Windows machine:
* The `file_group` that's supposed to copy some files into the testing directory wasn't working on Windows. I've changed it to use `copy_to_bin` instead.
* A bunch of tests were failing, because they were assuming that the machine they were being run on is Unix based. I've reworked them to use regexes which should work against all platforms.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "test(localize): fix integration test failures on windows" (#40932)

Issues.Title: Uglified UMD bundle for PlatformBrowser broken
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report

### Affected Package

```@angular/platform-browser```

### Description

The minimized UMD bundle of `@angular/platform-browser` cannot be used. If any ngModule imports the `BrowserModule` an error will be thrown on bootstrap.
Somehow, the prototype of the global exports from platform-Browser will be mangled.

platform-browser.umd.js:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5240450/108565433-f573c300-7304-11eb-834c-37b7c40d708b.png)
platform-browser.umd.min.js:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5240450/108565449-fdcbfe00-7304-11eb-8458-92ca782620e6.png)
Which leads to the injection error shown below.
The other UMD bundles are fine so far.

### Is this a regression?

Since I'm probably the only human on earth that ~~uses~~ [used](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/20056#issuecomment-781899902) those UMD bundles, it's not that high priority I guess. 
To put it more precise, I stopped checking after **Angular 7**

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5240450/108565557-2ce26f80-7305-11eb-9b90-f4cbeac2c59e.png)

Just wanted to mention this here. Maybe the bug can reveal something interesting to prevent further issues in the future related to minification.

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction

Just bootstrap an application importing the minified UMD bundle, e.g. 
```
<script src="node_modules/@angular/platform-browser/bundles/platform-browser.umd.min.js"></script>
``` 

## üî• Exception or Error

```
definition.ts:753 Uncaught Error: Type t does not have '…µmod' property.
    at getNgModuleDef (definition.ts:753)
    at recurse (ng_module_factory_registration.ts:49)
    at recurse (ng_module_factory_registration.ts:61)
    at registerNgModuleType (ng_module_factory_registration.ts:45)
    at new NgModuleFactory (ng_module_ref.ts:121)
    at compileNgModuleFactory__POST_R3__ (application_ref.ts:66)
    at PlatformRef.bootstrapModule (application_ref.ts:401)
    at first.mfe.ts:29
    at angular-mfe-first.umd.js:4
    at angular-mfe-first.umd.js:5
``` 


## üåç  Your Environment

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5240450/108565360-d6753100-7304-11eb-8b91-3d6a6b830cc7.png)


**Anything else relevant?**
Both the usual bundle and the ivy-compiled bundle (running `ngcc`) have this issue

cheers
flash ‚ö°
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Uglified UMD bundle for PlatformBrowser broken" (#40926)

Issues.Title: Add a SortBy pipe/function akin to AngularJs' one
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ feature request

### Description
In AngularJS we have the `orderBy` pipe. But Angular seems to intentionally not have it.

There used to be an explanation of why the Angular team thought it was a bad idea to have such pipe [here](https://angular.io/guide/pipes#appendix-no-filterpipe-or-orderbypipe). But as you can see, the info is now missing from this page.

I've seen already other feature requests related to this: #2956 and #11337 and the summary of why the pipe should not be added seems based on:

> Angular 2 is unlikely to offer such pipes because (a) they perform poorly and (b) they prevent aggressive minification

But, correct me if I'm wrong:
* With pure pipes we don't need to worry in this case about (a) because as long as the input doesn't change, the pipe won't be executed.
* Nor worry about (b) because the implementation doesn't necessarily need to interfere with minification, as minification doesn't change the strings 'name' nor 'dob' that we pass in the template like `people | sortBy:['name', 'dob']` nor with the content of the list `people`. I've read that "sortBy relies on reflection" but that's not necessarily true, right?

The solution I've seen from the Angular team in those old issues is "do your own" but then, how come doing my own doesn't interfere with minification? and why is performance less of a concern there?

The main reason I'm requesting this is that when your users are upgrading from AngularJs to Angular they already need to do a fair amount of work. Not providing a 1:1 migration path in things like this, and asking every team to either write their own version of the pipe or trust one found in the Internet seems prone to bugs, raises security concerns and requires us to spend even more time.

### Describe the solution you'd like

I see these possible solutions:
- **Adding the pipe to Angular** but I've seen this has been answered multiple times with "no" so not putting my money on this one.
- **Adding the pipe to Angular as a separate npm package** just like you did with [material-moment-adapter](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@angular/material-moment-adapter).
- **Providing a function to sortBy** that we can use in our controllers and that mimics AngularJs' one.


### Describe alternatives you've considered
* Using lodash, but although it allows sorting by multiple fields, it doesn't allow specifying the asc/desc order.
* Copying somebody's implementation to our company's codebase (but then I'm not making Angular better, next time there will be another frustrated user that needs to invest time into figuring out why Angular doesn't have this AngularJs pipe).

### Lastly
In case you consider any of those solutions is a "go", I can provide the PR.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Add a SortBy pipe/function akin to AngularJs' one" (#40927)

Issues.Title: Clarify documentation around svg fragments in templates
Issues.Body:
# üìö Docs or angular.io bug report

### Description

The Angular guide contains a section on how to use svg elements in templates, but this only deals with "complete" elements which include the base <svg> tag.

It is also useful to define components which render svg fragments within an existing parent svg element, which is not covered in the current docs. These only appear to work if the elements are prefixed with an (undefined?) "svg" namespace prefix.

Please update the docs to:
* Clarify if this is working as intended, or is just a by-product of the implementation which just happens to work.
* Include a similar example.

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction

### Full Example
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-ivy-5schxp

### What's the affected URL?
https://angular.io/guide/svg-in-templates

### Reproduction Steps

```ts
// app.component.ts
interface SvgRect {
  x: number;
  y: number;
  text: string;
}
export class AppComponent  {
  rects: SvgRect[];
}
```
```html
<!-- app.component.html -->
<!-- create a separate g for each rect -->
<svg width="200" height="100">
  <g svgRect *ngFor='let rect of rects' [rect]="rect"></g>
</svg>
```
```ts
// svg-rect.component.ts
@Component({
  selector: '[svgRect]',
  template: `
      <rect
          [attr.x]="rect.x" [attr.y]="rect.y" width="80" height="30"
          stroke="black" stroke-width="1" fill="transparent"></rect>
      <text
          [attr.x]="rect.x + 40" [attr.y]="rect.y + 15"
          dominant-baseline="middle" text-anchor="middle">{{rect.text}}</text>
  `,
  styles: []
})
export class SvgRectComponent  {
  @Input() rect: SvgRect;
}
```
This template as written does not render anything, although inspecting the underlying html looks ok. Following the advice in [this SO issue](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/48453514/angular-svg-matching-component-with-svg-elements), adding the "svg" namespace prefix to the component template elements does render correctly:
```ts
  template: `
      <svg:rect
          [attr.x]="rect.x" [attr.y]="rect.y" width="80" height="30"
          stroke="black" stroke-width="1" fill="transparent"></rect>
      <svg:text
          [attr.x]="rect.x + 40" [attr.y]="rect.y + 15"
          dominant-baseline="middle" text-anchor="middle">{{rect.text}}</text>
  `,
```
Would also be good to clarify whether the selector should include the svg namespace if restricted to a specific element:
```ts
  selector: 'g[svgRect]',
  selector: 'svn:g[svgRect]',
```
Thanks
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Clarify documentation around svg fragments in templates" (#40916)

Issues.Title: fix(forms): unsubscribe from async validator when the directive is destroyed
Issues.Body:
In the current behavior, the asynchronous validator is not unsubscribed,
thus creating a memory leak. For example, asynchronous validators can execute
HTTP requests, the HTTP request may still be in `pending` status when the directive
has already been destroyed. The `validate` method may capture `this` (e.g. if it references
the `HttpClient`) thus preventing the directive from being GC'd.

This RP adds a call to the `_cancelExistingSubscription` method when the directive is destroyed.

Issues.Title: HttpHeaders .toString() implementation
Issues.Body:
<!--üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ

Oh hi there! üòÑ 

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->


# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
<!-- Can you pin-point one or more @angular/* packages the are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: --> This feature request is for @angular/common/http


### Description
HttpHeaders toString implementation.

We need to persist Angular requests when the app is offline and might be killed only to be restored later. We are providing a custom proxy HttpClient implementation with added capabilities.

Sadly HttpHeaders are not serializable directly and while this is implemented as part of our proxy implementation I don't see why this couldn't be implemented directly into the class just like HttpParams did with it's own .toString() other than bundle size or extra code to mantain.

As it is currently HttpHeaders constructor signature takes only strings and normalizes also XHR requests takes only k/v strings.

### Describe the solution you'd like
Add .toString (and optionally JSON.stringify) implementation to HttpHeaders.

### Describe alternatives you've considered
It's not a particularly hard problem and there's a myriad of ways of solving it from client code perspective.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "HttpHeaders .toString() implementation" (#40904)

Issues.Title: Style Guide still recommends Codelyzer which is being deprecated
Issues.Body:

Issues.Title: Angular 12: Update dependencies jasmine-spec-reporter
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [x] new - [ ] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] extract-i18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Not applicable ### Description - When creating angular applications, latest stable dependencies should be pulled from NPM - However, when creating angular 12 application, version of [`jasmine-spec-reporter`](https://www.npmjs.com/package/jasmine-spec-reporter) is `5.0.2` when it should be `6.0.0` ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction - (Optional) Create global angular config file to use `yarn` package manager if not present. `cat ~/.angular-config.json` ```json { "version": 1, "cli": { "packageManager": "yarn" } } ``` - `npx @angular/cli@12.0.0-next.1 new web-apps --create-application false` - `cd web-apps && yarn outdated` ``` Package Current Wanted Latest Package Type URL @types/node 12.20.4 12.20.4 14.14.31 devDependencies https://github.com/DefinitelyTyped/DefinitelyTyped.git jasmine-spec-reporter 5.0.2 5.0.2 6.0.0 devDependencies https://github.com/bcaudan/jasmine-spec-reporter ts-node 8.3.0 8.3.0 9.1.1 devDependencies https://github.com/TypeStrong/ts-node ``` ## üî• Exception or Error

Issues.Title: Angular 12: Don't include deprecated TSLint by default
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [x] new - [ ] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [x] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] extract-i18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Issues.Title: Error during npm test after updating Angular
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report

### Affected Package
I believe the issue was introduced by one of the updated packages by `ng update @angular/core @angular/cli`.

### Is this a regression?
Yes, the issue was not present in version 11.0.0

### Description
After updating the Angular dependencies of the library `angular-archwizard` from `11.0.x` to latest by executing `ng update @angular/core @angular/cli`, `npm test` fails with the following error message:

```
$ npm test

> angular-archwizard@8.0.0-develop test ~/git/angular-archwizard
> ng test && ng test --tsConfig=tsconfig-noIvy.spec.json

Compiling @angular/core : es2015 as esm2015
Compiling @angular/common : es2015 as esm2015
Compiling @angular/core/testing : es2015 as esm2015

‚úî Browser application bundle generation complete.
21 02 2021 18:51:53.859:INFO [Firefox 85.0 (Linux x86_64)]: Connected on socket xICXANRpTidBS4xtAAAB with id 42976427
```

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction

4. execute the tests `npm test`

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): force less version 3.5 math behaviour
Issues.Body:
In version 4, LESS did a breaking change that set `parens-division` as the default math setting. With this change we change the behavior to mimic version 3.5.

See: https://github.com/less/less.js/releases/tag/v4.0.0

**Note**: In Angular CLI version 12, the math setting will be the default provided by the LESS compiler in v4.0.0

Closes #20088
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): force less version 3.5 math behaviour" (#20097)

Issues.Title: feat(@angular-devkit/build-angular): enable inlineCritical by default
Issues.Body:
BREAKING CHANGE:

Critical CSS inlining is now enabled by default. If you wish to turn this off set `inlineCritical` to `false`.

See: https://angular.io/guide/workspace-config#optimization-configuration
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(@angular-devkit/build-angular): enable inlineCritical by default" (#20096)

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>webpack/webpack</summary>

### [`v5.23.0`](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack/releases/v5.23.0)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack/compare/v5.22.0...v5.23.0)

### Features

-   add `parserOptions.url: "relative"` option
    -   Allows to generate relative URLs from `new URL` (e. g. for SSG/SSR)

### Bugfixes

-   fixes for electron target
    -   electron has importScripts in worker
    -   only choose a chunkLoading which fits to the chunkFormat
    -   prefer fetch wasm loading over node wasm loading
-   fix regression when combining library + runtimeChunk + node target

### Developer Experience

-   export MultiStats type

### [`v5.22.0`](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack/releases/v5.22.0)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/webpack/webpack/compare/v5.21.2...v5.22.0)

### Features

-   generate shorter output code for JSON data by using a `'...'` string instead of `"..."` (only affects output side when not minimized)
-   the `dependencies` configuration option now works for watch builds too
    -   It will build compilation when any of `dependencies` has changed
    -   It will wait for compiling until all of `dependencies` have finished
-   add `parallelism` config option on the array of configurations to limit the compilers that are running in parallel

### Developer Experience

-   add hints (`Did you mean ...`) to resolve errors when
    -   resolving fails due to `enforceExtension`
    -   relative request is missing leading `./`
-   when all modules of an entrypoint fail resolving and another entrypoints `depend(s)On` it, webpack no longer crashes with a weird error
-   add hint to stats how to get details about errors/warnings in child compilations
-   improve error message for lazyCompilation when using IE11

### Bugfixes

-   async entries e.g. for Workers are now implicitly flagged as "having side effects" even if they are affects by `"sideEffects": false`
    -   in future we might add a warning for this
-   avoid crash when using `this.loadModule` (loader) and the loaded module has errors
-   refactor libraries to inline exporting code into runtime to allow using with `output.iife: false`
-   fix invalid code when using `define` for local modules and arrow functions are supported
-   fix missing runtime requirement for system.js context
-   fix parsing of `define` function, which missed declarations before
-   avoid unnecessary calls to loaders when serializer are already registered
-   fix inner graph analysis for exports when `export { x }` is before pure declaration `const x = /*#__PURE__*/ f()`
-   fix hashing order of runtime chunks when there are async entries involved

### Contribution

-   CI run tests on node.js 15 too
-   CI run tests on github actions too

### Experiments

-   improvements on experimental `output.library: { type: "module" }` (`experiments.outputModule: true`)
    -   it can generate `export { ... }` now, but that can't handle live-bindings yet

</details>

##### Bug Fixes

-   **compiler-cli:** `readConfiguration` existing options should override options in tsconfig ([#​40694](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/40694)) ([b7c4d07](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/commit/b7c4d07e81277f7aed566e443d1d4e1395c5a2f4))

##### Features

-   **common:** support ICU standard "stand alone day of week" with `DatePipe` ([#​40766](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/40766)) ([c56ecab](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/commit/c56ecab515c28d2ad45c630080bfbf549675528a)), closes [#​26922](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/26922)
-   **forms:** add `emitEvent` option for AbstractControl-based class methods ([#​31031](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/31031)) ([4ec045e](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/commit/4ec045e12b7614b901d4ef643988b86f09dfeee5)), closes [#​29662](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/29662)
-   **platform-server:** allow shimming the global env sooner ([#​40559](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/40559)) ([43ecf8a](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/commit/43ecf8a77bc7e92d3c635b450de904732e938e64)), closes [#​24551](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/24551) [#​39950](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/39950) [#​39950](https://togithub.com/angular/angular/issues/39950)

##### BREAKING CHANGES

-   **forms:** The `emitEvent` option was added to the following `FormArray` and `FormGroup` methods:

-   FormGroup.addControl
-   FormGroup.removeControl
-   FormGroup.setControl
-   FormArray.push
-   FormArray.insert
-   FormArray.removeAt
-   FormArray.setControl
-   FormArray.clear

If your app has custom classes that extend `FormArray` or `FormGroup` classes and override the
above-mentioned methods, you may need to update your implementation to take the new options into
account and make sure that overrides are compatible from a types perspective.

Issues.Title: For the compiler to detect missing template files within libraries.
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ Feature request

For the compiler to detect missing template files within libraries. Currently, on build of a library, if the template file is missing/invalid within a component, the error is vague and doesn't point back to the offending file or line. Instead, it just references the part of the compiler that has fallen over.

### Command

- [x] build (specifically `ng build {library-name}`)

### Description

When the build is executed in a project where the following invalid code exists:

```
@Component({
  selector: 'peanuts',
  templateUrl: './some-missing-file.component.html',
  styleUrls: ['./peanuts.scss'] // Error is helpful when changed to: "some-missing-file.scss"
})
```

The current error given in the CLI is this:

```
BUILD ERROR
Cannot read property 'length' of undefined
TypeError: Cannot read property 'length' of undefined
    at new _Tokenizer (/my-project/node_modules/@angular/compiler/bundles/compiler.umd.js:10503:42)
    at tokenize (/my-project/node_modules/@angular/compiler/bundles/compiler.umd.js:10462:16)
    at HtmlParser.Parser.parse (/my-project/node_modules/@angular/compiler/bundles/compiler.umd.js:11093:35)
    at HtmlParser.parse (/my-project/node_modules/@angular/compiler/bundles/compiler.umd.js:11428:43)
    at I18NHtmlParser.parse (/my-project/node_modules/@angular/compiler/bundles/compiler.umd.js:17982:48)
    at DirectiveNormalizer._preparseLoadedTemplate (/my-project/node_modules/@angular/compiler/bundles/compiler.umd.js:16276:55)
    at /my-project/node_modules/@angular/compiler/bundles/compiler.umd.js:16270:80
    at Object.then (/my-project/node_modules/@angular/compiler/bundles/compiler.umd.js:2491:81)
    at DirectiveNormalizer._preParseTemplate (/my-project/node_modules/@angular/compiler/bundles/compiler.umd.js:16270:30)
    at DirectiveNormalizer.normalizeTemplate (/my-project/node_modules/@angular/compiler/bundles/compiler.umd.js:16256:40)
    at CompileMetadataResolver.loadDirectiveMetadata (/my-project/node_modules/@angular/compiler/bundles/compiler.umd.js:18448:62)
    at /my-project/node_modules/@angular/compiler/bundles/compiler.umd.js:18629:41
    at Array.forEach (<anonymous>)
    at CompileMetadataResolver.loadNgModuleDirectiveAndPipeMetadata (/my-project/node_modules/@angular/compiler/bundles/compiler.umd.js:18628:45)
    at /my-project/node_modules/@angular/compiler/bundles/compiler.umd.js:23827:69
    at Array.forEach (<anonymous>)
```

There is no reference to what caused the compiler to fall over.

### Describe the solution you'd like

Something more in line with the `styleUrls` 'not found or unreadable' error would be better:

```
BUILD ERROR
File to read not found or unreadable: /my-project/projects/my-library/src/lib/components/peanuts/some-missing-file.scss
```

or like in a standard project:

```
ERROR in ./src/app/cashews/cashews.component.ts
Module not found: Error: Can't resolve './some-invalid-file.html' in '/my-other-project/src/app/cashews'
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "For the compiler to detect missing template files within libraries." (#20080)

Issues.Title: Schematics - visit function performance
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ Feature request


### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->
- [x] schematics

### Description

The tree and directory in schematics allow you to `visit` each file in that tree/dir, and the handler function runs on each file in series which can be time consuming.


### Describe the solution you'd like

Implement a concurrent version of visit that would allow multiple files to be processed at the same time. This solution can be done in addition to `visit` via `visitConcurrent` or `visitAsync`.

The number of concurrent handlers would be handled via an argument and therefore controlled by the consumer.

Also this would likely be handled via RxJS so an observable should be returned by the new `visit____` function.

### Describe alternatives you've considered
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> Have you considered any alternative solutions or workarounds?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Schematics - visit function performance" (#20079)

Issues.Title: fix(material/bottom-sheet): focus restoration not working inside shadow dom
Issues.Body: Related to #21796. The bottom sheet focus restoration works by grabbing `document.activeElement` before the sheet is opened and restoring focus to the element on destroy. This won't work if the element is inside the shadow DOM, because the browser will return the shadow root. These changes add a workaround.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material/bottom-sheet): focus restoration not working inside shadow dom" (#21975)

Issues.Title: refactor(material/list): remove deprecated APIs for v12
Issues.Body:
Cleans up the deprecated APIs for v12 from the `material/list` package.

BREAKING CHANGES:
* The `mat-list-item-avatar` CSS class has been replaced with `mat-list-item-with-avatar`.
* `MatSelectionListChange.option` has been removed. Use `MatSelectionListChange.options` instead.
* `MatListItemHarnessBase.getHarnessLoaderForContent` has been removed. Use
`MatListItemHarnessBase.getChildLoader(MatListItemSection.CONTENT)` instead.
* The `tabIndex` input has been removed from `MatSelectionList`.
* The `MatSelectionList` constructor has been changed to remove the `tabIndex` parameter and to turn `_focusMonitor` into a required parameter.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor(material/list): remove deprecated APIs for v12" (#21974)

Issues.Title: bug(mat-form-field): mat-form-field inputs not rendering properly when deployed
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. Add form markup to template file using mat-form-field elements with input elements displaying the 4 different appearances.
2. View app in browser.
 
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-ivy-gl3pev

#### Expected Behavior

What behavior were you expecting to see?

I expect the mat-form-fields of the deployed app to render exactly as they do when the app in run locally.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/78363807/108604033-681e8600-7379-11eb-84fb-4cebbd09476e.png)

#### Actual Behavior

What behavior did you actually see?

The mat-form-fields render incorrectly on stackblitz:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/78363807/108604060-900de980-7379-11eb-9ad2-f6978051fae7.png)

Also render incorrectly when app is hosted in SharePoint Online on a Web Part Page using a Content Editor Web Part:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/78363807/108604116-c5b2d280-7379-11eb-98dd-5406e159ad11.png)

Another observation, textarea fields seem to render just fine in mat-form-field elements.

I followed this article to deploy angular apps to SharePoint Online:

https://www.c-sharpcorner.com/article/sharepoint-with-angular/

I'm fairly new to Angular and feel that a dependency was missed or misconfigured during deployment?  Having said that, I merely copied & pasted the code of my simple example app to stackblitz & it doesn't render properly there either.

In SharePoint, sometimes I get a 404 error, but not always:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/78363807/108604809-2217f100-737e-11eb-8e69-9b24d87dc295.png)

#### Environment

- Angular: 10.0.14
- CDK/Material: 10.2.7
- Browser(s): Chrome 88.0.4324.182 (Official Build) (64-bit)
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows 10

Angular CLI: 10.0.8
Node: 13.12.0
OS: win32 x64

Angular: 10.0.14
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms

Issues.Title: test(material/select): remove form-field dependency in deselection test
Issues.Body:
The existing test would not work without using mat-form-field wrapper because the trigger.click() propagates to onContainerClick of FormField which calls select.open() a second time.
With this change, the logic does not base on propagating/onContainerClick but on specific open and close commands of the panel.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "test(material/select): remove form-field dependency in deselection test" (#21963)

Issues.Title: fix: add predicate function to configurable focus trap and allow focus to escape sidenav
Issues.Body:
Split up into the following commits:
1. Adds an option to the `ConfigurableFocusTrap` which can be used to pass in a predicate function that will determine whether focus is allowed to escape.
2. Uses the new option from the first commit to allow for focus to move between the sidenav and the sidenav container.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix: add predicate function to configurable focus trap and allow focus to escape sidenav" (#21962)

Issues.Title: build: bump sass from 1.29.0 to 1.32.8
Issues.Body:
Bumps [sass](https://github.com/sass/dart-sass) from 1.29.0 to 1.32.8.
Release notes

Sourced from sass's releases.

Dart Sass 1.32.8

To install Sass 1.32.8, download one of the packages below and add it to your PATH, or see the Sass website for full installation instructions.

Changes

  • Update chokidar version for Node API tests.

JavaScript API

  • Allow a custom function to access the render() options object within its local context, as this.options.

See the full changelog for changes in earlier releases.

Dart Sass 1.32.7

To install Sass 1.32.7, download one of the packages below and add it to your PATH, or see the Sass website for full installation instructions.

Changes

  • Allow the null safety release of stream_transform.

  • Allow @forward...with to take arguments that have a !default flag without a trailing comma.

  • Improve the performance of unitless and single-unit numbers.

See the full changelog for changes in earlier releases.

Dart Sass 1.32.6

To install Sass 1.32.6, download one of the packages below and add it to your PATH, or see the Sass website for full installation instructions.

Changes

Node JS API

  • Fix Electron support when nodeIntegration is disabled.

Dart API

  • All range checks for SassColor constructors now throw RangeErrors with start and end set.

See the full changelog for changes in earlier releases.

... (truncated)

Changelog

Sourced from sass's changelog.

1.32.8

  • Update chokidar version for Node API tests.

JavaScript API

  • Allow a custom function to access the render() options object within its local context, as this.options.

1.32.7

  • Allow the null safety release of stream_transform.

  • Allow @forward...with to take arguments that have a !default flag without a trailing comma.

  • Improve the performance of unitless and single-unit numbers.

1.32.6

Node JS API

  • Fix Electron support when nodeIntegration is disabled.

Dart API

  • All range checks for SassColor constructors now throw RangeErrors with start and end set.

1.32.5

  • Potentially breaking bug fix: When using @for with numbers that have units, the iteration variable now matches the unit of the initial number. This matches the behavior of Ruby Sass and LibSass.

Node JS API

  • Fix a few infrequent errors when calling render() with fiber multiple times simultaneously.

  • Avoid possible mangled error messages when custom functions or importers throw unexpected exceptions.

  • Fix Electron support when nodeIntegration is disabled.

1.32.4

  • No user-visible changes.

1.32.3

Issues.Title: bug(mat-sidenav): focus trapping is too aggressive under certain conditions
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

This issue seems to manifest under the following conditions:
- Sidenav is open in `over` or `push` mode (does not happen in `side` mode).
- Backdrop is disabled (this is necessary to be able to click in the content area of a `over` or `push` sidenav.
- App is using the `ConfigurableFocusTrap` (does not happen with the deprecated `FocusTrap`).

Steps to reproduce:
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-avy29p?file=src%2Fmain.ts
1. click to focus the "Content" input 
 
#### Expected Behavior

"Content" input remains focused.

#### Actual Behavior

"Drawer" input immediately steals focus.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(mat-sidenav): focus trapping is too aggressive under certain conditions" (#21955)

Issues.Title: build: bump highlight.js from 10.5.0 to 10.6.0
Issues.Body:
Bumps [highlight.js](https://github.com/highlightjs/highlight.js) from 10.5.0 to 10.6.0.
Release notes

Sourced from highlight.js's releases.

Version 10.6.0

New Languages:

  • Added 3rd party Laravel Blade grammar to SUPPORTED_LANGUAGES (#2944) Michael Newton

Language grammar improvements:

  • enh(scala) fix triple quoted strings (#2987) Josh Goebel
  • enh(perl) Much improved regex detection (#2960) Josh Goebel
  • enh(swift) Improved highlighting for operator and precedencegroup declarations. (#2938) Steven Van Impe
  • fix(xml) Support single-character namespaces. (#2957) [Jan Pilzer][]
  • enh(ruby) Support for character literals (#2950) Vaibhav Chanana
  • enh(powershell) Add three VALID_VERBS and update the reference link (#2981) davidhcefx

Grammar Deprecations:

  • Deprecate c-like, though you should not be using it directly anyways.
    • will be removed in v11.
  • c and cpp are now wholly unique grammars that will diverge over time

Parser:

  • new simpler highlightAll() API (#2962) Josh Goebel
    • this should be a drop-in replacement for both initHighlighting() and initHighlightingOnLoad()
    • note: it does not prevent itself from being called multiple times (as the previous API did)
  • beginKeyword no longer bestows double relevance (#2953) Josh Goebel
  • allow keywords to be an array of strings Josh Goebel
  • add modes.MATCH_NOTHING_RE that will never match
    • This can be used with end to hold a mode open (it must then be ended with endsParent in one of it's children modes) Josh Goebel

Deprecations:

  • initHighlighting() and initHighlightingOnLoad() deprecated.
    • Please use the new highlightAll() API instead.
    • Deprecated as of 10.6.
    • These will both be aliases to highlightAll in v11.
Changelog

Sourced from highlight.js's changelog.

Version 10.6.0

New Languages:

  • Added 3rd party Laravel Blade grammar to SUPPORTED_LANGUAGES (#2944) Michael Newton

Language grammar improvements:

  • enh(scala) fix triple quoted strings (#2987) Josh Goebel
  • enh(perl) Much improved regex detection (#2960) Josh Goebel
  • enh(swift) Improved highlighting for operator and precedencegroup declarations. (#2938) Steven Van Impe
  • fix(xml) Support single-character namespaces. (#2957) [Jan Pilzer][]
  • enh(ruby) Support for character literals (#2950) Vaibhav Chanana
  • enh(powershell) Add three VALID_VERBS and update the reference link (#2981) davidhcefx
  • fix(php) Highlighting of anonymous functions without {} block Vaibhav Chanana

Grammar Deprecations:

  • Deprecate c-like, though you should not be using it directly anyways.
    • will be removed in v11.
  • c and cpp are now wholly unique grammars that will diverge over time

Parser:

  • new simpler highlightAll() API (#2962) Josh Goebel
    • this should be a drop-in replacement for both initHighlighting() and initHighlightingOnLoad()
    • note: it does not prevent itself from being called multiple times (as the previous API did)
  • beginKeyword no longer bestows double relevance (#2953) Josh Goebel
  • allow keywords to be an array of strings Josh Goebel
  • add modes.MATCH_NOTHING_RE that will never match
    • This can be used with end to hold a mode open (it must then be ended with endsParent in one of it's children modes) Josh Goebel

Deprecations:

  • initHighlighting() and initHighlightingOnLoad() deprecated.
    • Please use the new highlightAll() API instead.
    • Deprecated as of 10.6.
    • These will both be aliases to highlightAll in v11.

Issues.Title: Screenreaders do not say that mat-option is a checkbox role
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report
### Is this a regression?
Not that we're aware of.

### Description
The following screenreaders:
-ChromeVox on ChromeOS
-JAWS on Windows
-NVDA on Windows
-Voiceover on Mac
do not voice the checkbox role when tabbing through a list of mat-items in a multiple selection mat-select.

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction
0) Enable a screenreader
1) Visit https://material.angular.io/components/select/overview#multiple-selection
2) Go to multiple selection example
3) Select on mat-select box
4) Using keyboard navigation, tab through items. select and deselect at will.
5) Notice how the screenreaders do not voice that a mat-option has a checkbox role.

## üåç  Your Environment
ChromeVox on ChromeOS
JAWS on Windows
NVDA on Windows
Voiceover on Mac
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Screenreaders do not say that mat-option is a checkbox role" (#21948)

Issues.Title: ChromeOS ChromeVox does not voice selected status of mat-option in multiple selection mat-select
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report

### Is this a regression?
Not that we're aware of.

### Description
ChromeVox screenreader on ChromeOS does not voice the selected status of a mat-option in a multiple selection mat-select when you tab over a selected item.

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction
0) Enable ChromeVox on ChromeOS machine
1) Visit https://material.angular.io/components/select/overview#multiple-selection
2) Go to multiple selection example
3) Select on mat-select box
4) Using keyboard navigation, tab through items and select one
5) Tab away and tab back to selected item and notice how Chromevox does not voice that this item is currently selected.

## üåç  Your Environment
ChromeOS, built-in ChromeVox screenreader

**Anything else relevant?**
This issue is present on ChromeOS machines.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "ChromeOS ChromeVox does not voice selected status of mat-option in multiple selection mat-select" (#21949)
